original_text:
Here is another great product I discovered to use with my Note 2. This particular unit has a very portable footprint and it's relative slim with dimension of 119mm x 74mm x 18mm (4.7\\" x 2.9\\" x 0.7\\"). It's also pretty lightweight for 7000 mAh capacity, at 6.8 oz (193 g). It's definitely very comfortable and pocket/purse friendly. As a matter of fact, this unit is actually intended to be used on the go where you don't even have to worry about power cables since it has built in full usb cable for Input charging (a fast 5V, 1A port) and also micro-usb cable for one of the Output charging ports (5V, 1A). In addition to 1A output port with micro-usb cable, it also provides 2 additional usb ports with 2.1A and 1A outputs. These got you covered for any smart phone or tablet, and can also charge two devices at the same time.

For convenience if input charging cable is not long enough for you, New Trent also included USB extension chord which I found to be a great bonus. No other chords or adapters were included with this product. The device itself is very slick with a footprint reminding me a small external hard drive. The bottom of this power bank is finished matte while the top has a shiny piano finish. On the top you also have a discretely placed power button and 4 led power meter indicators with cool green lights. Those 4 lights partition power reading into 25% increments.

Beside its portability and convenience of built in cables, the main attraction of this device is a whooping 7000 mAh capacity. This is some serious number!!! And NT70T has this 7000 mAh speced at 3.7V - the voltage of the actual lithium battery. To be honest, I was a little skeptical at first because external battery market is flooded with a lot of high capacity external batteries that have exaggerated labels. So right away I put this battery to the test. I had my Note 2 discharged down to 25% while NT70T was charged all the way to full (4 leds lit up). I used 2.1A output port fora faster charging and used my own usb-to-micro-usb cable. My Note 2 battery got charged up to 100% in under 3 hours. That was very impressive. After charging it up, I checked with NT70T and it still had 3 leds on!!!! Of course, 3 leds doesn't mean it's at full 75% charge, but rather between 50% and 75% charge. But still, very impressive considering we are talking about our GN2 with 3100 mAh stock battery. As a bonus, you can actually charge your phone while charging NT70T, pretty cool although not recommended by manufacturer since it can accelerate aging of the battery.

In my opinion this is one of the top small footprint portable external battery chargers that offers simultaneous charging of two devices at the same time with one port being 2.1A and others at 1A, and having a whooping true 7000 mAh capacity!!! A must have if you need a portable backup battery and don't wont to part with your current smart phone case (to accommodate bulky extended battery). I definitely recommend NT70T EasyPack!
translated_text: Here is another great product I discovered to use with my Note 2. This particular unit has a very portable footprint and it is relatively slim with the size of 119mm x 74mm x 18mm (4.7\" x 2.9\" x 0.7\"). It is also pretty lightweight for 7000 mAh capacity, at 6.8 oz (193 g). It is definitely very comfortable and pocket/pump friendly. As a matter of fact, this unit is actually intended to be used on the go where you don't even have to worry about the power cable as it has built in full USB cable for Input charging (a fast 5V, 1A port) and also micro-usb cable for one of the Output charging ports (5V, 1A). It is also pretty lightweight for 7000 mAh capacity, at 6.8 oz (193 g). It is definitely very comfortable and pocket/p/pump friendly. As a matter of fact, this unit is actually intended to be used for any smart phone or tablet. This is not even if you have to worry about the top-pumpumpumpumpumpumpumpumpumpumpumpumpump

original_text: The Alpine type -R. Where do I begin? I've been in the car audio scene before I could legally drive. I am now 30 years old and still enjoy it. Don't get me wrong, there are a few subwoofers that outclass the type-r in my OPINION. i.e. L7's (kicker), and the W7's (JL) but for the price.... they can't be touched. I can't believe someone would put these under audiobahn. The alpine type-r will not fall apart, blow, or distort if matched with the proper amp and wired correctly. I was so impressed I am now curious if something for a $100 dollars sounds so good what do the type-x's sound like. Might have to buy a pair and find out. If you seriously want a great and powerful system for under a thousand dollars go with the type-r's as your subs. Don't cheap out and go audiobahn, lanzar, soundstream, sony, or any other cheaply priced and manufactured subs. Those subs are priced under 50 dollars for a reason. One alternative is power acoustik. We murdered a soundstream demo vehicle during a sound off at a grand opening of a electronics store that is \\"ultimate\\" with a power acoustik based system.

Don't get me wrong, there are a few subwoofers that outclass the type-r in my OPINION. i.e. L7's (kicker), and the W7's (JL) but for the price.... they can't be touched. I can't believe anyone would put these under the audiobahn. The alpine type-r will not fall apart, blow, or distort if matched with the correct amp and wired correctly. I was so impressed I'm now curious if something for a $100 dollars sounds so good what the type-x's sound like. Might have to buy a pair and find out. If you seriously want a great and powerful system for under a thousand dollars go with the type-r's like your subs. Don't go audiobahn, lanzar, soundstream, sony, or any other cheaply opened system for a great power-d-d-d-d-

original_text: When I purchased my Nikon D7000 camera 2 years ago I looked for an insurance policy that would extend the manufacturer's warranty.  I found Square Trade.  I read through all of the 'small print' and decided to purchase a 3 year policy that included Accidental Breakage.  Until now I did not need to use the policy, but when the camera was not taking photographs that were up to the quality I was used to, I chose to send it in to Nikon for repair.  Within a couple of days of receiving the repaired camera Square Trade had reimbursed the full amount of the repair.  I had one call to Square Trade and could not have been more satisfied.  My iPad and 2 other camera lenses are also insured with Square Trade.  I have peace of mind!  Thank you Square Trade!!!
translated_text: When I bought my Nikon D7000 camera 2 years ago I looked for an insurance policy that would extend the manufacturer's warranty. I found Square Trade. I read through all of the 'small print' and decided to buy a 3 year policy that included Accidental Breakage. Until now I didn't need to use the policy, but when the camera was not taking photos that were up to the quality I used to, I chose to send it in to Nikon for repair. Within a couple of days of receiving the repaid camera Square Trade had reimbursed the full amount of the repair. I had one call to Square Trade and could not have been more satisfied. My iPad and 2 other camera lenses are also insured with Square Trade. I have peace of mind! Thank you Square Trade!!!

original_text: I received this pouch today and I can't find a bad thing to say about it. I like the exterior (I have the black Maya) almost as much as I like the interior - bright lime green and very soft! I love the pouch style (much better than a silicone or clip-on hard case that gathers dust in the corners), and after seeing theunits3 rave about the Maya case on Youtube, I knew this case was the one I wanted.    My Zune HD slid inside beautifully and seems pretty happy - not a really tight fit, as the case would probably have with an Apple product, but a comfortable fit. I won't be just tossing the case into my purse because the Zune would probably eventually slide out, but tucked into a pocket of any purse it would be just fine.    I'd like to add that Proporta is a great company to interact with. Their package came to me with the contents hand-written, and a small present comes wrapped up in the invoice :) Thoughtful and fun, and refreshing in these modern times.
translated_text: I received this bag today and I can't find a bad thing to say about it. I like the exterior (I have the black Maya) almost as much as I like the interior - bright lime green and very soft! I love the bag style (most better than a silicone or clip-on hard case that gathers dust in the corners), and after seeing theunits3 rave about the Maya case on Youtube, I knew this case was the one I wanted. My Zune HD slid inside beautifully and looks pretty happy - not a really tight fit, as the case would probably have with an Apple product, but a comfortable fit. I will not just be tossing the case into my bag because the Zune would probably eventually slide out, but tucked into a bag of any bag it would just be fine. I would like to add that Proporta is a great company to interact with. Their package came to me with the hand-written contents, and a small present comes wrapped up invoice :) Thinking and refreshing, and in these modern times.

original_text: You're actually getting 3 products here- a shoe pouch to  hold the Nike+ transmitter, an armband to hold your Ipod (with or without your Nike+ plugged in), and also a screen protector for your Ipod.     Pros- Seller was awesome helping me confirm I was ordering the correct item to fit my generation of Ipod Nano. This was the hardest part for me. The shoe pouch is laced into your shoes & then velcros closed & seems very secure so I don't worry I'll lose the transmitter with this at all. The armband doesn't bother me when I run but it might for some that are sensitive to it. It's very adjustable for different arm sizes (my arms are small & it works great). I like that the Ipod holder is made from a smooth silicone material & is easy to plug in my my Nike + into the Ipod.  Easy to take the armband off & on. Also comes with a screen protector for the Ipod. Comes with great instructions that are easy to follow to adjust armband, put on screen protector, & lace up shoe pouch. I have not had any problems with my Nike+ finding/reading my transmitter in my shoe or the accuracy but I'm not someone that  takes my distance too seriously. (You do need to calibrate your Nike+ (instructions on Nike website) to make it more accurate.) Works fine for my weekly 5k runs!    Cons- The pouch has to be laced into the shoe which is somewhat time consuming so not good if you want to quickly remove the shoe pouch or wear your running shoes without the pouch on it a lot. (It is easy to remove the transmitter chip inside however- since it just velcros closed.) Also the pouch is not water-proof. As for the Ipod holder on the armband- the silicone Ipod holder part seems like it could tear easily if you are not careful inserting & removing your Ipod. Includes instructions that explains how to avoid that. (I wouldn't recommend this product if you won't be keeping your Ipod in the silicone skin most the time for that reason.) The screen protector was not really exciting for me but I guess it's a nice added bonus.     Overall these are great quality products for the price & I don't run without them!
translated_text: You’re actually getting 3 products here- a shoe bag to hold the Nike+ transmitter, a bracelet to hold your iPod (with or without your Nike+ plugged in), and also a screen protector for your iPod. Pros- Seller was awesome helping me confirm I was ordering the correct item to fit my generation of iPod Nano. This was the hardest part for me. The shoe bag is laced into your shoes & then velcros closed & looks very secure so I don’t worry I’m going to lose the transmitter at all. The bracelet doesn’t bother me when I run but it might for some who are sensitive to it. It’s very adjustable for different arm sizes (my arms are small & it works great). I like the iPod holder is made from a smooth silicone material & is easy to plug in my Nike + into the iPod. Easy to take these bracelets off & on. I don’t really’t worry I’t get the bracelet’s screen protector for I’s though if I’t run as well as I’s for I’s for the

original_text:
New Trent products just keep getting better and better! The NT70T is a sweet little product that I will get a lot of use out of. To be honest, I like everything about the NT70T. It's compact, easy to carry, looks good, and not very heavy. I am fond of the glossy black look, even though it attracts smudges, but it's very easy to wipe off. I especially like the built-in USB cables. They not only look nice on the pack, but they are extremely handy for charging the device and my cell phone without having to plug in cables, and they fit on the sides of the device perfectly. The two USB ports and built-in cables are labeled on the device and very easy to read. The included USB extended cable is good quality and very appreciated. The packaging of the device in the plastic box is top notch. Very classy and appealing to me.

It charges my Samsung Galaxy Tab Plus from 50% to full charge in 2 hours and 15 minutes, and I can get two charges to my Tab with it. It will charge my Galaxy Tab, my cell phone, and my Phillips Mp3 player together, and I can use my tablet as it charges if I want to.

It took 7 hours, 30 minutes to charge the device from 0% to full using the AC adapter that came with my Galaxy Tab, and 8 hours to charge using my laptop USB. Ideal to charge overnight.

This is the thing that really impressed me though...I charged the device to 100% four days ago, and haven't used it since. Before I wrote this review, I was curious how much it might have discharged in four days. When I connected it to my laptop USB, I still had four solid green bars! No noticeable discharge at all!

I am impressed with the New Trent products, and their customer service is the best I ever dealt with. I highly recommend the NT70T. It really is darn near perfect.
translated_text:
New Trent products just keep getting better and better! The NT70T is a sweet little product that I will get a lot of use out of. To be honest, I like everything about the NT70T. It is compact, easy to carry, looks good, and not very heavy. I love the glossy black look, even though it attracts smudges, but it is very easy to wipe off. I especially like the built-in USB cables. translated_text: I have had my new e-book reader cover for 2 weeks now and absolutely love it. I am happy with the design and quality and the color is just as it appears in the photo ad. I have no problem accessing the necessary buttons to use on my reader and like it has spaces on the left to put in a library card etc and a larger space for written notes. Overall I am very satisfied with this purchase/

original_text: This retro looking alarm clock is much more than just that; it charges my iPhone 5 and allows me to see the screen without having to pick the phone up.
translated_text: This retro looking alarm clock is much more than just that; it charges my iPhone 5 and allows me to see the screen without having to pick up the phone.

original_text: Works great!  Sounds great!  Very low static compared to much more expensive ones i've used.  Even in the city where there are very few open stations, it finds one no problem and works great.  The battery has lasted me 2 weeks now, so I don't know what the complaints are about.  Plus this uses only 1 battery, compared to other brands I've used which takes 2 batteries.  Even if you get slightly shorter battery life, your only using 1 battery per change ,vs 2.  Think about it!  :)
translated_text: Works great! sounds great! Very low static compared to much more expensive ones I've used. Even in the city where there are very few open stations, it finds one no problem and works great. The battery has lasted me 2 weeks now, so I don't know what the complaints are about. Plus this uses only 1 battery, compared to other brands I've used which takes 2 batteries. Even if you get slightly shorter battery life, your only using 1 battery per change ,vs 2. Think about it! :)

original_text: This is a nice case, it does the job, and I love the little pocket with a cloth to wipe the screen. However, my only small complaint (and my fault for not considering this, and ordering the bigger one) is that you cannot carry the power cord in the case with the navi.  This would have been helpful when you are switching cars, etc. Other than that it seems like a good quality case that will last.

However, my only small complaint (and my fault for not considering this, and ordering the larger one) is that you cannot carry the power cord in the case with the navi. This would have been helpful when you are switching cars, etc. Other than that it seems like a good quality case that will last.

Be careful pulling the mast out from the housing the first time. It's a very snug fit and being impatient will increase the likelihood that you will bend it.

original_text: I bought this media player to watch movies in my RV.  Just the thing to get the movies from my portable hard drive to my TV.  Works great.  But this handy item can do more.  I'm going to get an internal hard drive for it and eliminate the need for a portable hard drive.  Just what you want in a small space.    This media player is small, compact and well built.  So easy to operate. I will use it to back up my notebook files on the road, along with my pictures and music.  It has really streamlined my traveling electronics and computer accessory requirements.  Less is always more in an RV.  Thanks Micca for an awesome product.
translated_text: I bought this media player to watch movies in my RV. Just the thing to get the movies from my portable hard drive to my TV. Works great. But this handy item can do more. I'm going to get an internal hard drive for it and eliminate the need for a portable hard drive. Just what you want in a small space. This media player is small, compact and well built. So easy to operate. I will use it to backup my notebook files on the road, along with my pictures and music. It has really simplified my traveling electronics and computer accessory requirements. Less is always more in a RV. Thank Micca for a wonderful product.

original_text: These are great, they protected the itouch very well, though we sold it and now we don't have the item.
translated_text: These are great, they protect the itouch very well, though we sold it and now we don’t have the item.

original_text: I've had this for a little over 3 weeks and it's my first and only Nook cover.  The pattern is beautiful and I get so many compliments on it!  It's a little darker than it appears in this picture, but I like that better. It's not too bright at all.  It even has little gold accents around a few of the white blossoms that adds a nice touch. I was a little nervous about the magnets in there with the touch screen, but it doesn't seem to be causing a problem at all; probably because it really doesn't come in contact either either scree since the magnets sit on the edges.  I enjoy the little inside pocket and ID card slot as well and also has a little pen loop in the middle.  I might even get one of the other colors to switch out every once in a while just for fun!
translated_text: I have had this for a little over 3 weeks and it’s my first and only Nook cover. The pattern is beautiful and I get so many compliments on it! It’s a little darker than it appears in this picture, but I like that better. It’s not too bright at all. It even has little gold accents around a few of the white flowers that adds a nice touch. I was a little nervous about the magnets in there with the touch screen, but it doesn’t seem to be causing a problem at all; probably because it doesn’t really come in contact either screw since the magnets sit on the edges. I enjoy the little inside pocket and ID card slot as well and also has a little pen loop in the middle. I might even get one of the other colors to switch out every time just for fun!

original_text: Great cable, no complaints so far.  Charges our ipod and both iphone 6 we have with no problems. The cable doesn't feel cheap and may be a little more robust than OEM. The cable has a rubber type feel to it and is fairly flexible.  The strain relief areas at either end where the connectors attach to the cable seem like they are stronger than the OEM Lightning cable.  Overall I have no hesitations recommending these cables to anyone looking for a replacement.
translated_text: Great cable, no complaints so far. Charges our ipod and both iphone 6 we have with no problems. The cable does not feel cheap and may be a little more robust than OEM. The cable has a rubber type feel to it and is fairly flexible. The strain relief areas at any end where the connectors attach to the cable seem like they are stronger than the OEM Lightning cable. Overall I have no hesitation recommending these cables to anyone looking for a replacement.

original_text:
I copied my review for the blue case since I bought the blue and pink cases at the same time:

I recently bought iPods for my children and the thought of spending another $30 each on similar protective cases was annoying. I searched Amazon and found these cases in blue and pink. The pink was same as pic listed. First you put the iPod in the hard case, then you wrap the gel case around the shell. Comfortable to hold. The cameras, ear plug, and charge port are not blocked and easily accessed. We do not dock our iPods, so I can't comment there. The case has withstood a drop to the kitchen floor and patio. No problems and I believe this a great value.

I currently have an Otterbox cover for my iPod and I am looking to replace with one of these covers. I think I will get better protection.
translated_text:
I copied my review for the blue case since I bought the blue and pink cases at the same time:

I recently bought iPods for my children and the thought of spending another $30 each on similar protective cases was annoying. I searched for Amazon and found these cases in blue and pink. The pink was the same as the pic listed. First you put the iPod in the hard case, then you wrap the gel case around the shell. Comfortable to hold. The cameras, ear plug, and charging port are not blocked and easily accessible. We do not dock our iPods, so I can not comment there. The case has withstand a drop to the kitchen floor and patio. No problems and I believe this a great value.

I currently have an Otterbox cover for my iPod and I am looking to replace with one of these covers. I think I will get better protection.

original_text: Finally a reasonably priced , longer charging cable that actually works! Thank you!
translated_text: Finally a reasonably priced, longer charging cable that actually works!

original_text: This product is very impressive.  Thanks to the other reviews, I was able to apply the protector correctly without any problems.  My husband & I teamed up during the process with him pressing down on the protector as I peeled it back slowly. We put it on in landscape rather than what the directions said.  Just like in other 4&5 star reviews, this protector cuts down on the glare as well as reduces the smudging.  Great product!
translated_text: This product is very impressive. Thanks to the other reviews, I was able to apply the protector correctly without any problems. My husband & I teamed up during the process with him pressing down on the protector as I peeled it back slowly. We put it on in landscape rather than what the directions said. Just like in other 4&5 star reviews, this protector cuts down on the glare as well as reduces the smudging. Great product!

original_text:
I use this device to transmit a DirecTV satellite receiver output to my earbuds (plugged into a cheap $24.00 Bluetooth audio adapater from Wally World), about 15' across the room. The manual says to keep the transmitter within 5 feet of the receiving device, which, if that were the case, I would have returned it. At 15' there is no breakup or background noise. The audio quality is far superior to what I had been using: an FM transmitter (common for car stereo setups) to a Sony Walkman am/fm radio on FM. While the latter setup works, there is a lot of background noise and cross/same channel interference because the Sony FM portable receives so many FM stations that there is always interference. Also, moving around (like rolling over), causes the signal to come and go on FM, hence my desire to try a Bluetooth solution)

This is where Bluetooth comes in. No interference whatsoever, No problem pairing this transmitter with the el cheapo Wally World Bluetooth receive adapter (which also works very, very well). I am taking the line level out of the DirecTV receiver and using the supplied adapter cable that came with the transmitter to get the audio from the sat receivre to the transmit adapter. I leave the transmit adapter plugged in all the time to the provided charging cable (a simple USB wall charger). On the receive side, the Wally World receive adapter is also powered all the time. Both devices appear to have an internal Li-ion battery, but they can both be left on charge power during normal use without risk to the batteries.

The transmit adapter is about 1\\" square and 1/8\\" thick, weighs next to nothing. The cheap Wally World receive adapter is very similar in size and weight, and it has the standard 1/8\\" (3.5 mm) stereo jack output)

If you want to duplicate this setup, keep in mind we are using \\"line level\\" audio, so there is no volume control. As it turns out, the audio level is perfect for night time listening with just a common setof \\"Frogz\\" ear buds. If I felt I needed volume control, I could find a set a ear buds with built in volume control, but so far, there is no need. The line levels are quiet enough to not \\"keep me awake\\", but certainly loud enough for clearly understandable dialog.

N.B. Concerning the \\"delay\\" referenced in other reviews: Using it on the DirecTV sat receiver, there is a perceptible delay, but it is very, very slight. If I look really hard to spot this \\"issue\\", I can see it now and then...and to be honest, that problem manifests all on its own from DirecTV without any bluetooth transmitter. Nevertheless, there is \\"some\\" delay, however slight, but not enough to confuse or even mildly annoy me. Further, I got it to \\"fall asleep\\" to, so most of the time I have the TV off when listening to this setup. I did make a point, however, of evaluating the delay carefully before writing this review. It is possible that each device may show differing delays, but I don't see the kind of delays that some have written about. Maybe I will in the future, but so far, there just isn't any issue. Maybe the pairing of this transmitter with the el cheapo Wally World receiver adapter is just a happy marriage. Who knows?

Highly recommended (both transmitter and receiver).
translated_text: I use this device to transmite it or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or or

If it wasn't for all the other things I carry, I wouldn't need a purse! Needless to say I love it!

original_text: These cables (lightning) are far superior to most all other cables on the market and even Apple's own. i am 100% satisfied with this product. I'm mostly impressed with the durability and build quality. I never get any error messages when charging (like most third party products).
translated_text: These cables (lighting) are far superior to most of all other cables on the market and even Apple's own. I am 100% satisfied with this product. I am mostly impressed with the durability and build quality. I never get any error messages when charging (like most third-party products).

original_text:
This unit performs exactly as advertised. I use it for climbing and mountaineering. Works great - even under partial tree cover. Once above treeline, no issues at all - messages were sent within seconds. I even got some replies! The Iridium constellation provides excellent coverage and unit queues messages when it can't find a bird to communicate with. I used the iPhone interface without any problems, it makes composing text messages a breeze. One small quibble: the down-arrow on my unit is a bit squirrelly - DeLorme offered to replace it no charge.

Each message has a link to a website with a map of the location the message was sent from. The links work great and the maps are beautiful. The people following me really appreciated the ability to reply right off the map link page.

I had no trouble with activation. The day I activated it was pouring rain, so I sat in my car and held the unit up to the window. It worked fine and I was able to send messages right away.
translated_text:
This unit performs exactly as advertised. I use it for climbing and mountaineering. Works great - even under partial tree cover. Once above the treeline, no issues at all - messages were sent within seconds. I even got some responses! The Iridium constellation provides excellent coverage and unit queues messages when it cannot find a bird to communicate with. I used the iPhone interface without any problems, it makes composing text messages a breeze. One small quibble: the down-arrow on my unit is a bit squirrelly - DeLorme offered to replace it no charge.


Each message has a link to a website with a map of the message was sent from. The links work great and the maps are beautiful. The people follow me really appreciated the ability to respond right off the map link page.

I had no problem with activation. The day I activated it was casting rain, so I kept the unit up to the window. It worked fine and I was able to send messages right away.
